titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Bryan, Summons
CWG4362

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Todd Circuit Court
October 19th 1863
The Commonwealth
against } Summons on Forfeited Recognizance
James Bryan

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth and it appearing that the Defendant has been duly summoned and failing to appear although solemnly called but made default. Upon hearing the evidence It is considered by the Court That the Commonwealth have execution James Bryan for the sum of Five hundred Dollars being the amount he acknowleedged indebted to the Commonwealth of Ky in his recognizance in the sum mentioned together with her cost herein expended

A Copy
Attest
Ben T Perkins C T C C

The Comth
vs } copy of Judgement
John James Bryan
